item.title: Architecture
item.description: Software Architecture is not as physical as building architecture, it’s equally important for creating well-structured and functional applications. Here are some basic software architecture concepts to get you started: Components and Modules: Imagine building blocks. Software is broken down into smaller, independent pieces called components or modules. Each module has a specific function and interacts with others in defined ways. Modularity: This principle emphasizes the importance of breaking down complex systems into smaller, manageable modules.
